quotes: Amre Moussa was the Permanent Representative of Egypt to the U.N (1990 - 1991)
Amre Moussa was the Permanent Representative of Egypt to the U.N (1990 - 1991), the Foreign Minister of Egypt (1991-2001)
Amre Moussa was the Permanent Representative of Egypt to the U.N (1990 - 1991), the Foreign Minister of Egypt (1991-2001) and the Secretary General of the League of Arab States, (2001-2011)
He ran for president of Egypt in the first democratic elections following the 25th January Revolution
He was elected member of the Constitutional Assembly to write the constitution of 2012
Amre Moussa was one of the leaders who called for and marched during the June 30th revolution
The assembly succeeded in producing the new constitution which was approved on 18th January 2014
Last updated: Oct 03, 2025
